strings.Value: "Darven? The rebellious murderer Linxia is searching for?"
"So, what do you want, Darven?"
"Guards! Seize this half-elf!"
"Tell me your story."
"So what did this Chelish noble do to make you so angry?"
"What do you want from me, Darven?"
"You aren't convincing me."
"You figured you'll buy me?"
"I have no wish to fight with Linxia."
[Lie] "Deal. I'll help you."
"Deal. I'll help you."
"I won't take sides — neither yours, nor hers. You can figure this out among yourselves."
[Attack] "You're a criminal. You belong on the gallows!"
"So, how much do I cost, by your estimations?"
"Absolutely!"
"Make it 15000. Then we'll talk."
"20000. I won't take any less than that."
"{g|Hellknights}Hellknights{/g} are not the most courteous guests, are they? And the hellknights from the {g|Order of the Rack}Order of the Rack{/g} are the vilest of them all."
{n}A tanned-skin half-elf with green eyes looks at you respectfully, but with a smile on his face.{/n} "My name is Darven."

"Yes, I'm a rebel, a murderer, a pirate, a renegade, a smuggler — and I have lots of other scary titles." {n}The half-elf laughs lightly, but watching you closely at the same time.{/n} "If you listen to Linxia, I'm evil incarnate, baby-eater — your worst nightmare came true. If the end of times should ever come, it will be because of me, and me alone."

"First of all — I should explain myself." {n}You hear the note of guilt in the half-elf's voice.{/n} "After all, I was the reason this crazy zealot stormed upon your lands. She won't stop until she turns every house in the neighborhood upside down, hoping to find my hat, my sock, or a flea that had my passing acquaintance."
{n}The half-elf takes a step back, obviously frightened.{/n} "Hold on, I beg you. Let me at least make a statement in my defense. I assure you — you time will not be wasted."

{n}Darven utters a sad sigh.{/n} "Of course, all of Linxia's accusations are false. That is to say, they are not entirely true. It's true I am involved in this story, but my sins are not so great as they are thought to be."
"Ah, I'm glad you asked. I've so much to offer!"
"You see, I'm rich. And I don't mind sharing my riches with those who can help me with my troubles. Linxia, on the other hand, will give you nothing. I doubt she'd even say 'thank you'."
"Don't you want even hear what I have to offer?" {n}Darven looks slightly worried.{/n}
"Why not? Everything, and everyone, has a price. It's just a matter of negotiation."

"I know where Linxia has set up her temporary camp — in a Secluded Lodge on the edge of the southern {g|Narlmarches}Narlmarches{/g}. Go there. Convince her to stop chasing me. Order her. Kill her, if needed. It shouldn't be difficult. So what do you say? Do we have a deal?"
"Perhaps you'll manage to convince her to leave peacefully... Though I won't count on that."

"I'm so glad to hear it!" {n}Darven's smile remains as smug as before, but you feel a hint of relief behind it.{/n} "Please, deal with Linxia as soon as possible. I'll find you after you resolve the situation."
"A pity. Such a pity." {n}Darven sighs.{/n} "Still, if I were you, I would go talk to Linxia. She'll never get me, but her zeal will continue causing trouble for your subjects. Farewell!"
"So, that's how it is? Most unpleasant, but not entirely unexpected." {n}Darven raises his eyebrow and dissipates into thin air. It turns out you've been talking with his illusion all along.{/n}
"That's a fine question! I suppose... 10000 gold coins will be a satisfactory amount for you?"
"I'm glad I wasn't mistaken about you."
"You're very good at haggling, I'll give you that. Well, I have respect for honest negotiations. Let it be 15000. Do we have a deal?"
"Unfortunately, at the moment I can't afford to pay more. Let's agree on 10000, and put the rest on my tab?" {n}Darven gives you a disarming smile.{/n}
{n}Darven forces himself to smile.{/n} "Oh, if only my situation weren't so critical… But I accept your terms. So, do we have a deal?"
